entry.title: Move dependency name logic into BUILD.gn templates
entry.content:
Rather than compute the GN target path to each dependency in Rust

code, simply pass what's needed to the template: the dependency

package name and version.



The templates are tailored to each build setup, so the rule path

prefix can be hard-coded into the template. Likewise, the decision

between ":lib" and ":buildrs_support" is based on which dep list its

in, so this can also be handled by the template.



Bug: None

Change-Id: I171c60bc47dcc27fdecb8b356bb515502f6e1a76

entry.title: Adjust MakoDialogView bounds based on its height.
entry.content:
When resizing the mako ui, adjust its anchor rect and bounds so that

short mako ui is anchored at the cursor and tall mako ui is centered on

the display screen containing the cursor.



This is a bit of a hack to get the correct mako ui positioning while

avoiding explicit calls between the mako WebUI and backend. See

https://docs.google.com/document/d/18LSu-iLOSKZ9FxkWusg1gYW5evGgc4kXrDKyMQr7I68/edit?usp=sharing



Will probably tweak things in followups, e.g. consider adjusting

kMakoHeightThreshold based on screen height.

entry.title: [Nearby][Self Share] Implement Self Share Success Metrics
entry.content:
Create Nearby.Share.IsSelfShare boolean histogram.



Add 'SelfShare' as a variant to the ContactStatus token in

Nearby.Share.Transfer.Success.{Direction}.{ShareTargetType}.{ContactStatus}

and similarly '.SelfShare' as a variant to the Variation token in

Nearby.Share.Transfer.FinalStatus{Variation}.



These metrics will allow for calculation of Self Share success rate,

Self Share attempts / Nearby Share attempts, and total Nearby Share

attempts.



Tested: manually on DUT with Self Share enabled/disabled.

Fixed: b/279502099

Change-Id: I05448f70848b7a60da5eb883e1eeb0b998d44f84

entry.content:
Some portal implementations (like GNOME) will refuse to create a dialog

if a filter name is empty. This CL fixes a bug where the filter name

could be empty. This could occur since the previous code assumed that

an extension description override is nonempty if one is provided.

2023-09-12T23:08:42.747041Z FATAL browser_tests[325873:325873]: [scalable_iph_browser_test_base.cc(114)] Check failed: !mock_delegate_. Mocks have already been set up.

#8 0x55e2699e883b content::BrowserTestBase::ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop()

[...]



Original change's description:

> Add phone hub onboarding eligible condition

>

> - This CL adds x_CustomConditionPhoneHubOnboardingEligible. The

> condition is true if feature status of Phone Hub is either

> kEligiblePhoneButNotSetUp or kDisabled.

> - This adds a dependency from ScalableIph to PhoneHubManager.

> PhoneHubManager is expected to be initialized at a specific timing.

> This CL makes sure that ScalableIph is initialized after

> PhoneHubManager.

> - This CL fixes an issue with our OOBE flow test in our browser tests.

> - To fix the browser test, we had to change behavior of

> LoggedInUserMixin. Previously LoggedInUserMixin has configured

> LoginManagerMixin to skip post login screens by default. This CL

> makes it optional.

> - familiy_user_device_metrics_browsertest.cc was depending on the

> default behavior. This CL updates the test.

entry.title: Add scaffolding for performance side panel
entry.content:
We are working on finalizing the design for the contents of the new

performance side panel and need to prototype how the different

performance cards will be displayed. To simplify prototyping, we are

checking in the scaffolding for a blank side panel. This will allow us

to test how to pipe data in and render the results without having

multiple people needing copies of this boilerplate.

entry.title: Add configurable sort mode for the source list
entry.content:
The order of the source list is sometimes changing seemingly at random.



This CL adds an additional sort mode that uses the order that is

returned from CGWindowListCopyWindowInfo().



The sort mode is configurable through the Finch feature

ThumbnailCapturerMac sort_mode. The following values are

valid for sort_mode



kNone - No extra sorting, same order as returned by SCShareableContent.

kCGWindowList - Same order as returned by CGWindowListCopyWindowInfo().

kNewWIndowsLast - Static order where new windows are put last in the

list.

entry.title: customization: Adds duplicate device id finder
entry.content:
The InputDeviceDuplicateIdFinder finds devices with matching VID/PIDs

so that the settings and button recognition can apply to all devices

with the same VID/PID. This allows us to recognize devices across

categories as being the same physical device.

entry.title: Hide connect with a code button when screen is locked
entry.content:
When the screen is locked, users may still cast using quick settings.

The 'Connect with a Code' option is shown even in this state, however

when clicked nothing happens, since the WebUI dialog that usually opens

cannot be shown on top of the lock screen.



This changes the button so it is not shown if the screen is locked.

entry.title: arc/gio: Release all touch events when mouse interrupts
entry.content:
There is an issue on Android side that both mouse events and touch

events are instances of MotionEvent. When the touch MotionEvent is

active and mouse MotionEvent interrupts, the previous touch MotionEvent

is generated as a cancel event, which puts some games in a weird state.

For example, the character may keep running without stop.



This CL:

- Adds an extra touch release event to finish the previous touch

MotionEvent onAndroid side before sending mouse events to solve this

issue.

- Replaces DispatchTouchCancelEvent by DispatchTouchReleaseEvent to

avoid future issues like this.



Bug: b/299704561

Test: manual test

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=*TouchInjector*

Change-Id: I7fb1a67ee92af66f4c43b338221fc26b1cd9c52c

entry.title: Cache bounds of document pip windows
entry.content:
Currently, Document PiP windows open in their default location every

time. Video PiP, in contrast, stays in the same place the user left

it for the current origin, as long as the user doesn't navigate away

and/or close the browser.



This CL adds similar functionality to Document PiP. Specifically,

the PiP window will open in the same place it was as long as:



- No other site has opened a PiP window in the same WebContents

since the last time this site did.

- The browser hasn't been closed

- The tab is still located on the same display

- The site is not requesting a different initial size for the

PiP window



Change-Id: I1cbb8502879c80f44eeb635f925cb88733cce329

entry.title: Notifier Collision Baseline Updates
entry.content:
Refactor notification pop-up baseline calculation, so instead of setting

a fixed baseline offset, the baseline is re-calculated every time one of

the following triggers happen:

- tray bubble visibility changes - includes sliders

- tray bubble bounds change

- popup collection height changes

- tablet mode changes



This ensures that the baseline is up to the most recent state and does

not assume state of UI that might still exist, preventing bugs such as

b/298268434, where the baseline was set to 0 after closing a bubble but

a slider view was still open.



Bug: b:278930021, b:298268434 , b:298123817

Change-Id: Ic38baa1d5165bb6ef4075108f747c48076398f3b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4854589

entry.content:
`ShadowController::UpdateShadowForWindow()`

update shadow based on ChromeOS related property changes.

entry.title: Strengthen the encryption in TokenEncryptor
entry.content:
The current encryption implementation in the encryptor uses the system

salt as both a key and a nonce, which is not good. This adds a new

version of the encrypt and decrypt functions which uses a random nonce

instead, and renames the existing functions to "Weak".



Ideally we could just replace the existing functions but that is tricky

because then we could no longer read existing tokens. This change

instead just puts in place the support needed to enable updating the

calling code. It does not actually attempt to change said code.



Bug: b:298194227

entry.title: VC UI: Remove early return in OnActiveUserPrefServiceChanged()
entry.content:
If AddNoiseCancellationEffect() is called before

OnActiveUserPrefServiceChanged(), an early return will be triggered and

AddLiveCaptionEffect() will never be called, resulting live caption is

not added to the VC panel. This CL remove that early return and support

with other logic so that this won't happen.

entry.title: Fix perf regression in AnchorElementMetricsSender when checking for a secure context
entry.content:
A recent change introduced the use of IsUrlPotentiallyTrustworthy to

determine whether a document with an HTTP URL could create a

AnchorElementMetricsSender, such as the case of localhost. This involved

making a copy of the URL to pass to the function, which can be expensive,

especially given that in some cases, this code is on a hot path (e.g. pages

with tens of thousands of anchors). We now use a method which gets the

same information in constant time.



Bug: 1481259

entry.title: IndexedDB: remove some more bucket thread to main thread deps
entry.content:
Directly notify the quota manager of bucket access when closing or

opening connections. The QuotaManagerProxy is thread safe.



Previously, when opening a new connection, the main context would also

query the disk to get an updated usage calculation. However, this

should not be necessary as it's redundant with FactoryOpened().



Likewise, when closing a connection, if it was the last connection, the

context would recalculate usage. This would have been redundant with

TransactionComplete().



Some already-stale includes are also cleaned up.

https://drafts.csswg.org/css-lists/#inheriting-counters

if element counters does not already contain a counter

with the same name. So, for all the s which

does not have counter-reset, we take the counter from

taking the value of the counter from the wrong source (counter with

entry.title: [Test Automation] ExecuteJs[At], CheckJs[At] fail on error
entry.content:
Previously, ExecuteJs, ExecuteJsAt, CheckJs, and CheckJsAt could swallow

relevant error information if an exception was thrown, or (in the case

of the ...At() versions) if the element was not present.



This rewrites the JS injection logic for these methods so that all

errors are caught and explicitly surfaced as test failures, with their

JS error messages. This includes any of:

- DeepQuery path not found

- Exception thrown by injected function

- Injected function returns a promise which then calls 'reject'



In order to handle the case where executed JS may destroy or navigate the current web page, an optional "fire and forget" mode is added to ExecuteJs[At] which preserves the old behavior (though you will not get error checking in that case).



Numerous tests ensuring functionality are also added.



Bug: 1478691

entry.title: Implement std::shared_mutex for R/W locks in StatisticsRecorder.
entry.content:
- Removes the use of the absl R/W lock in StatisticsRecorder.

(Previously enabled on non-iOS platforms). We found that

absl's R/W lock's implementation has too many issues (e.g.

starvation on iOS and some low-level. allocator crashes on

other platforms).

- Switches back to using a regular base::Lock by default.

Note: This was the behavior prior to:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4591175

- Adds support for using std::shared_mutex for R/W semantics

in StatisticsRecorder (same R/W locking calls as with absl).

- Adds support for doing an A/B test between the std::shared_mutex

R/W lock and base::Lock. Done as a synthetic trial since the code

runs before base::FeatureList is initialized. The trial will be

enabled in a follow-up CL.

- Tracks total time spent waiting for the lock (across all threads)

and records this (and resets the counter) with every UMA upload.

- Fixes a failing UserActivationStateTest.ExpirationTest test that

was mocking the clock and was sensitive to the number of

TimeTicks::Now() calls that were happening.



Note: This CL intentionally separates the code to enable the 50/50

trial for a future CL, so that we can separate the effects of the

other changes (e.g. extra time tracking for these locks) from the

effectof the lock implementation.



Note: The use of std::shared_mutex is still not generally approved

for Chromium, but this specific use has been discussed on cxx@, with

entry.title: [Tailored Security] Add sync and policy guards to retry logic
entry.content:
The retry logic for sync users should only run for users that are

syncing or who don't have a policy controlling the safe browsing

protection level setting. Prior to this change the retry logic would run

for everyone, and then it would rely on the tailored security logic for

deciding what to do. By using the guards to prevent scheduling the retry

logic, we conserve resources and queries for users where this tailored

security logic would not run.



The setup method of the test suite had to be changed in order to test

some of the logic that is in the constructor. To do this we now need to

keep track of whether `profile_manager_.SetUp()` has been called, to

prevent setting it up more than once. And we now need to support

enabling history sync or policy controls before the

ChromeTailoredSecurityService is instantiated.



Change-Id: I830f5ad748ae6cf2fb124c8192cd1755082d28f1

entry.title: [NTP] mv tiles: observe showAdd for rowCount
entry.content:
This fixes a very specific bug where single row mv tiles are overflowing

onto the next row by exactly one tile while also being full (10 mv

tiles). Therefore, there are 9 tiles on the first row and 1 tile on the

second. This causes an issue because the rowCount_ is dependent on

showAdd_, and both are dependent on tiles_. rowCount_ and showAdd_ will

update independently, with rowCount_ updating with the old value of

showAdd_ (false because there were a max number of tiles). This means

that the height of the container is expecting only 1 row of tiles and

not showing everything.



By making rowCount_ update when showAdd_ is updated, rowCount_ will be

updated again to go back to 2 when showAdd_ is set to true.



Note: There are computed values that are potentially creating a cycle

of computed values depending on each other. However, I tested it out

with console.logs and it doesn't seem to be creating a never ending

cycle.

entry.title: Fix race condition in URLLoaderTest.ClientAuthCertificateWith(Invalid|Valid)Signature
entry.content:
This patch fixes a race condition within the URLLoader gtests

ClientAuthCertificateWithInvalidSignature and

ClientAuthCertificateWithValidSignature that causes tests to fail.

Sometimes url_loader is nullptr and sometimes certificates has been

requested even though the test expects different.



The reason for this race condition relates to the usage of

RunLoop::RunUntilIdle. Before, the test did the following:



1. The test creates an URLLoader that requests a resource from

EmbeddedTestServer.

2. The test does RunLoop::RunUntilIdle

3. The test checks that no calls from URLLoader to

ClientCertAuthObserver::OnCertificateRequested has been made.



Most of the times, this succeeds. Sometimes it does not, mostly on

slower systems or on systems under heavy load. I think the reason is

that the test makes an incorrect assumption with regards to

RunLoop::RunUntilIdle and how threads are scheduled on an OS. What I

think happens is:



1. The network request to EmbeddedTestServer is made from the test main

thread.

2. The OS can context switch away from the test main thread before the

task system has reached an idle state.

3. The IO thread of EmbeddedTestServer responds to the request made by

URLLoader.

4. When the test thread is again scheduled, it has new data to fetch

from the server, triggering new tasks and completing the URL load.

This causes the checks that no progress on the URL request has been

made to fail.



This patch removes checks for temporary state that cannot be guaranteed

within URLLoaderTest.ClientAuthCertificateWith(Invalid|Valid)Signature

and instead makes the tests solely rely on expected end-state, for which

there's no race condition.



Bug: 843384

Change-Id: Ifdeeb6268ce74927172a1fa694fd48e81d19555f

CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/1222291

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4856128

Reviewed-by: David Benjamin

entry.title: Strictly enforce exclusive semantics for <details name>.
entry.content:
This change thoroughly enforces that at most one
element in a

group established by the name attribute is open at a given time. This

requires that we remove the open attribute during insertion into the DOM

in some cases, and also that we remove the open attribute for some

mutations of the name attribute.



This suppresses DOM mutation events (but not toggle events, which are

asynchronous) for the removals of the open attribute that result from

insertion.



This is based on discussion in (among other places):

https://github.com/openui/open-ui/issues/786

https://github.com/openui/open-ui/issues/812

entry.title: mac immersive fs: plumbs titlebar reveal state
entry.content:
ImmersiveModeController::IsRevealed() was always true even if the

toolbar is invisible. This causes some failures in BrowserViewTest.



This CL updates IsRevealed() so that it is true if and only if the

toolbar is actually visible on screen. The layout and painting code in

BrowserView is updated to ensure the toolbar is always ready to shown.



In this CL:

* Detect if the toolbar is revealed in remote cocoa. Plumbs it to

chrome/ level.

* Make ImmersiveModeController::IsRevealed() returns true iff the

toolbar is visible on screen.

* Add Browser::ShouldDrawTabStrip(). Replaces calls to

GetTabStripVisible() with ShouldDrawTabStrip() when necessary.

* Add ImmersiveModeControllerMac::OnImmersiveModeMenuBarRevealChanged().

This will be useful for positioning tabstrip according to the

visibility of the traffic lights (crbug.com/1414521)

entry.title: Clean up PrintRenderFrameHelper interaction with Blink.
entry.content:
Main goal: Avoid creating print layout twice.



Previously we'd enter print mode to figure out the page sizes and

orientation from CSS, set up print parameters based on the print layout,

then leave print mode, enter it again, and use the new parameters. This

is no longer necessary, since crrev.com/c/4725066 and other CLs

have made us capable of getting it right the first time.



Printing the current selection also used to enter and leave print mode

twice. First it would generate print layout for then entire document

(why?), and then it would generate print layout again, this time with

a generated document containing the selected text (which is what we

want).



Let CalculateNumberOfPages() just do that: calculate the number of

pages. Somehow, InitPrintSettings() had made its way in there. It's

better to do that on the outside, so that CalculateNumberOfPages()

doesn't have to relay any errors detected during initialization.



Fold CalculatePrintParamsForCss() into ComputePageLayoutForCss().



Rename and refactor code that enters print mode in

PrepareFrameAndViewForPrint. Hopefully more clear what's going on now.

The constructor will no longer enter print mode to modify

mojom::PrintParams and calculate blink::WebPrintParams, since this is

completely unnecessary. When print layout is required, either

BeginPrinting() or EnterPrintMode() needs to be called explicitly, and

once is enough. :)



PrintRenderFrameHelperTest.MediaQueryNoCSSPageMargins had to be

updated, because it was incorrect. Although valid per spec, this

doesn't reflect the behavior of Blink, or any other engine, for that

matter. See crrev.com/c/4727725 - CSS page margins should be ignored

for the sake of media query evaluation, although default margins from

print settings will be taken into account. MediaQueryNoCSSPageMargins

ran with non-zero default margins, so expecting it to match 8.5 by 11

inches was wrong. Add another test, MediaQueryDefaultCSSPageMargins,

which sets the print settings margins to zero, and additionally

specifies a CSS page margin (which should be ignored for media query

evaluation). Prior to this change, MediaQueryNoCSSPageMargins used to

pass incorrectly, because the CSS-specified margins ended up as default

margins in PrintParams in the second round, due to entangled logic in

ComputeScalingAndPrintParams() (this code is now gone).

CalculatePrintParamsForCss() was used before layout (with page index 0).

Therefore output from Blink was used as input in the next Blink layout

pass, letting @page margins affect media query evaluation.



Apart from fixing obscure bugs like the one above caused by the

hysteresis now untangled and removed, no behavior changes are intended

(except that it should be slightly faster to generate print layout once

instead of twice, obviously).



Change-Id: Ibfe336faaca961fd39f1539aff6d267b9ae5043e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4846834

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1195593}

entry.title: [FedCM] Fix bubble being shown when it should remain hidden
entry.content:
This patch affects two scenarios when tab is returning from hidden state

1. If IdP.close() was called on the sign-in to IDP pop-up, we check

whether pop-up is closed but accounts fetch is pending before

reshowing the dialog after returning from hidden state.

2. If IdP.close() was called on non sign-in to IDP pop-up (i.e. error

more details pop-up or AuthZ pop-up), we close the bubble widget so

there would be no bubble to show after returning from hidden state.



Bug: 1480140

Change-Id: If8dc702a3e85a6d92aab0afd70b6c23099767323

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Fix switch_1080p_720p_240frames.h264
entry.content:
switch_1080p_720p_240frames.h264 (the sequence used for Tast test

ChromeStackDecoder.v4l2_flat_h264_resolution_switch) apaprently has

some issue with the PPS numbering that throws the H264Parser off.

This is not a big deal since decoding works fine otherwise; since

the code that is thrown off is just for H.264 frame delimiting,

this CL reduces the severity of the error (to a warning) and a

returns true (as if the code had found the frame boundary.



That change fixes all v_d_a_tests with said sequence except for

entry.title: [FedCM] Check top frame's visibility instead of iframe's
entry.content:
Currently we only proceed with FedCM API if the render frame is visible.

This makes sense when FedCM is used in the top frame. However, it's

common for top frame to embed a cross-origin iframe, possibly invisible,

to invoke FedCM API.



This patch checks the top frame's visibility instead of the iframe's to

make sure FedCM API can be used as long as the top frame is visible.

entry.title: Leave page scale factor alone during printing, instead of resetting.
entry.content:
http://crbug.com/1117391#c10 suggests that the problem was caused by

PrepareFrameAndViewForPrint::ResizeForPrinting(). This function was

removed earlier this year, but may indeed have contributed. However,

even without that function, I could see that the scale factor was

updated via LayoutView::UpdateAfterLayout(), also when printing.



Therefore, just skip some (more) code in LayoutView::

UpdateAfterLayout(), and add a DCHECK to LocalFrame::SetScaleFactor()

that we're not printing.



This reverts the code changes from crrev.com/c/2423673 , and modifies

the test that was added, to require that the scale factor remain the

same as before printing. Resetting it to 1 after printing wasn't really

desirable anyway, although better than leaving the user at a "random"

scale factor, of course.



Discovered while trying to clean up the printing code.



Bug: 1117391

Change-Id: Id82ff0520e09b9bdccfc5617af0b5fe44d1c2717

entry.title: Enforce key name in policy dictionary to be lower case.
entry.content:
Registry key names are case-insensitive. To query the policies

correctly, we need to compare policy keys case-insensitive.

It looks `base::Value::Dict` does not support case-insensitive

search. As a workaround, we enforce the keys to be lower-case

when constructing the policy dictionary.



Please note cloud policy manager and managed preferences policy

manager (macOS) are already case-insensitive.



Bug: 1481325

entry.title: [PCCT-SideSheet] Enable CCTResizableSideSheet by default
entry.content:
Updates for tests in this CL:

- The mPCCTTestARule.mAttributeResults are now set twice, once for the positionAtHeight() call and once for positionAtWidth() call. This is due to the fact that with the CCTResizableSideSheet flag on by default the bottom-sheet will now be capped to 900dp width in landscape if the window's width in landscape is higher than that.

- Tests that are calling onConfigurationChanged are no longer applicable for PartialCustomTabBottomSheetStrategy as with CCTResizableSideSheet on by default the onConfigurationChanged override is only handled in PartialCustomTabDisplayManager and PartialCustomTabBaseStrategy. For the most part, equivalent tests as the ones removed exist in PartialCustomTabDisplayManagerTest.

entry.title: snap-group: `OverviewGroupItem` creation and removal
entry.content:
This cl implements the basic flow for `OverviewGroupItem` creation

and removal. The window in a snap group will be excluded from overview

if it is the 2nd window in mru order since the specific snap group

represented by this `OverviewGroupItem` has been created. When the

`OverviewItem`s hosted by the group item are empty, the corresponding

group item will be removed from the `OverviewGrid`.

entry.title: Honor page orientation for non-default margins and fit-to-page.
entry.content:
Even if the page size is to be ignored when fitting to paper,

orientation implied by @page size should be honored. Since Blink is now

in charge of setting the page size, this must also be done in Blink.

Remove the corresponding (and also slightly incorrect) code from

PrintRenderFrameHelper.



This also fixes crbug.com/1477190 for free.

EnsureOrientationMatches() messed up the margins (by simply transposing

the page area size). This function is now gone, and what

Document::GetPageDescription() does instead is correct, since it

transposes the page *box* [1], not the page *area*. [1]



[1] https://www.w3.org/TR/css-page-3/#page-model



Bug: 1481494, 1477190

Change-Id: Ib10036fdaa0c5a3b0f840ad12378bc793bd45e4b

entry.title: [3PCD][Mode B] Provide skeleton for Mode B Experiment Service
entry.content:
3PCD Mode B Experiment contains requirements that make certain clients

ineligible for the experiment. Some of these requirements depend on

profile attributes (like account holder age, enterprise users, etc.) and

others depend on the Chrome browser session (First Run Experience).



The tpcd::experiment::EligibilityService is a KeyedService (i.e. one per

profile) that looks at clients enrolled into the experiment through the

Finch trial configs and filters out the ineligible users based on the

requirements of the experiment. For each eligible profile, request the

UX Onboarding service to onboard the client into seeing the new UX. Once

onboarded, this service tells a client-wide manager service to register

this client for the synthetic trial, which will be used for experiment

analysis.



Change-Id: I4f059169757ea9db9679926c908d70215728f9d8

entry.title: Guard access to ContentBrowserClient in app shim code.
entry.content:
Since this code does not always run in the browser process, it really

shouldn't be using ContentBrowserClient, but it definitely shouldn't

do so without first verifying that there is a ContentBrowserClient.



Without this, attempting to properly initialize app shim base::Feature

state with state matching the browser process results in crashes

because some of this code suddenly starts running in app shim

processes. Note that these crashes would also happen when these features

are switched to be default enabled, rather than finch enabled.



Bug: 1378728

Change-Id: Id697af6c0edfce365b5c335c4df3d2af23f2db5a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4852023

Reviewed-by: Leonard Grey

Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink
